intro: Micrargeria wightii, commonly known as the Wight's micrargeria, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
